articles.author: Heekyong Yang
articles.description: North Korea said on Saturday it would consider any interference with its satellite operations a declaration of war and would mobilise its war deterrence if any attack against its strategic assets were imminent.
articles.title: North Korea says interference in its satellites would be declaration of war

articles.author: Manoj Kumar
articles.description: If India needed any more proof that it was in the midst of a huge housing boom, it got in this week's GDP data, heightening expectations that the industry will continue to power the economy for years to come.
articles.title: India's construction sector levels up as housing demand spurs economy

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Long-distance trains and hundreds of flights in and out of the German city of Munich were cancelled on Saturday because of heavy snowfall, according to statements by Deutsche Bahn and Munich Airport.
articles.title: Munich flights, long-distance trains cancelled due to snow

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket carried South Korea's first spy satellite into orbit on Friday from California's Vandenberg Space Force Base, after North Korea successfully launched its own military reconnaissance satellite last month.
articles.title: SpaceX launches South Korean spy satellite from California

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Control over Maryinka, a town in eastern Ukraine all but destroyed by more than a year of fighting, remained uncertain on Friday, with unofficial reports suggesting Russian forces had registered some gains.
articles.title: Control over devastated eastern Ukrainian town uncertain

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Philippines has built a new coast guard station on the contested island of Thitu in the South China Sea, boosting its ability to monitor movements of Chinese vessels and aircraft in the busy disputed waterway.
articles.title: Philippines builds new coast guard station on island in South China Sea

articles.author: Tom Balmforth
articles.description: Ukraine's domestic spy agency has detonated explosives on a Russian railway line deep in Siberia, the second attack this week on military supply routes in the area, a Ukrainian source told Reuters on Friday.
articles.title: Ukraine conducts new attack on Russian railway deep in Siberia - source

articles.author: Suhaib Salem, Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Renewed fighting in Gaza stretched into a second day on Saturday after talks to extend a week-old truce with Hamas collapsed and mediators said Israeli bombardments were complicating attempts to again pause hostilities.
articles.title: Renewed Gaza fighting stretches into second day after Israel-Hamas truce collapses

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Donald Trump does not have immunity from criminal charges for actions he took as president, a U.S. judge ruled on Friday, rejecting his bid to toss out the case brought by Special Counsel Jack Smith accusing him of unlawfully trying to overturn his 2020 election loss.
articles.title: Judge rejects Trump immunity claim in federal 2020 election case

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China's surge in respiratory illness is caused by known pathogens and there is no sign of new infectious diseases, a health official said on Saturday as the country faces its first full winter since lifting strict COVID-19 restrictions.
articles.title: China's respiratory illness rise due to known pathogens -official
